sen.j: 倫子女王（ともこ じょおう、元文3年1月20日 (旧暦)（1738年3月10日） - 明和8年8月20日 (旧暦)（1771年9月28日））は、江戸時代後期の皇族で、10代将軍徳川家治の正室。
sen.e: Princess Tomoko (March 10, 1738-September 28, 1771) was the imperial family in the late Edo period, and the lawful wife of Ieharu TOKUGAWA, the tenth shogun.
Princess Tomoko (March 10, 1738-September 28, 1771) was a member of the Imperial family in the late Edo period, and the lawful wife of Ieharu TOKUGAWA, the tenth Shogun.
Princess Tomoko (March 10, 1738-September 28, 1771) was a member of the Imperial family in the late Edo period, and the lawful wife of Ieharu TOKUGAWA, the tenth Shogun.

sen.j: 幼名は五十宮（いそのみや）。
sen.e: Her childhood name was Isonomiya.
Her childhood name was Isonomiya.
Her childhood name was Isonomiya.

sen.j: 元文3年（1738年）1月20日、閑院宮直仁親王の第六王女として京都に誕生。
sen.e: Born on January 20 1738 in Kyoto, as the sixth princess of the Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito.
She was born to be the sixth daughter of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito in Kyoto on January 20, 1738.
sen.cmt: She was born to beに訂正しました。sixth princess→six daughterに訂正しました。出生地と生年月日を後尾に移動しました。
sen.e: She was born to be the sixth daughter of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Naohito in Kyoto on January 20, 1738.

sen.j: 母は閑院宮家の女中の讃岐。
sen.e: Her mother was Sanuki, a maid of the Kanin-no-miya family.
Her mother's name was Sanuki who was a maid of the Kaninnomiya family.
sen.cmt: Her mother→Her mother's nameに、Sanukiのあとにwho was を追加しました。Kanin-no-miya→Kaninnomiyaに訂正しました。
sen.e: Her mother's name was Sanuki who was a maid of the Kaninnomiya family.

sen.j: 寛延元年（1748年）10月、京都所司代牧野貞通が朝廷と交渉し、倫子女王と徳川家治との縁組が決定された。
sen.e: In October 1748, Sadamichi MAKINO, the Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) negotiated with the Imperial Court and the marriage of Princess Tomoko and Ieharu TOKUGAWA were decided.
In October 1748, the marriage between Princess Tomoko and Ieharu TOKUGAWA was arranged, because the Kyoto shoshidai (the Kyoto deputy), Sadamichi MAKINO negotiated with the Imperial Court.
sen.cmt: 文法上、全体的に語順を訂正しました。
sen.e: In October 1748, the marriage between Princess Tomoko and Ieharu TOKUGAWA was arranged, because the Kyoto shoshidai (the Kyoto deputy), Sadamichi MAKINO negotiated with the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 寛延2年（1749年）2月に京都を発ち、3月に江戸へ到着するとすぐに江戸城浜御殿へ入った。
sen.e: She left Kyoto in February 1749, and as soon as she arrived to Edo in March, she entered the Hama Goten in the Edo-jo Castle.
She left Kyoto in February 1749, and once she arrived in Edo in March, she entered the Hama Goten (Hamagoten Palace) in Edo-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: as soon as→once, arrived to →arrived in, Hamagoteに(Hamagoten Palace）を追加しました。ｔhe Endo-jo Castleのtheを削除しました。
sen.e: She left Kyoto in February 1749, and once she arrived in Edo in March, she entered the Hama Goten (Hamagoten Palace) in Edo-jo Castle.

sen.j: 宝暦4年（1754年）12月に江戸城西の丸へ入輿し、以降は｢御簾中様｣と称された。
sen.e: In December 1754, she got married and entered to the nishi no maru (a castle compound to the west of the main compound) of the Edo-jo Castle, and since then she was referred to as 'gorenju (title of honor for legal wife of aristocrat as daijin, cabinet minister and kugyo, court noble) sama.'

In December 1754, she got married and entered the nishi no maru (the west palace which was a part of the castle) of Edo-jo Castle, which became her place to live; Since then she was called "gorenju" (the title of honor for a legal wife of a aristocrat as daijin, cabinet minister and kugyo, court noble).
sen.cmt: 文法上、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: In December 1754, she got married and entered the nishi no maru (the west palace which was a part of the castle) of Edo-jo Castle, which became her place to live; Since then she was called "gorenju" (the title of honor for a legal wife of a aristocrat as daijin, cabinet minister and kugyo, court noble).

sen.j: 宝暦6年（1756年）7月、家治との間に長女千代姫 (華光院)を産んだが、同姫はわずか2歳で夭折。
sen.e: In July 1756, she gave birth to her first daughter with Ieharu, Chiyohime (華光院), who later died at the age of 2.
In July 1756, she gave birth to the first daughter of her husband, Ieharu; Although the daughter was named Chiyohime (華光院), she died only at the age of 2.
sen.cmt: Her first daughter→the first daughterに訂正しました。Although, Onlyを追加しました。
sen.e: In July 1756, she gave birth to the first daughter of her husband, Ieharu; Although the daughter was named Chiyohime (華光院), she died only at the age of 2.

sen.j: 宝暦10年（1760年）4月、江戸城本丸へ移り、｢御台所様｣となる。
sen.e: In April 1760, she moved to the main ward of the Edo-jo castle, and became a midaidokoro (wife of a shogun or a highest-ranking nobleman).
In April 1760, she moved to the main ward of Edo-jo castle, and then she was called Midaidokoro (the wife of Shogun or a highest-ranking nobleman).
sen.cmt: Edo-jo Castleの前をthe削除しました。became→was called, midaidokoroの注釈訂正しました。
sen.e: In April 1760, she moved to the main ward of Edo-jo castle, and then she was called Midaidokoro (the wife of Shogun or a highest-ranking nobleman).

sen.j: 同年の8月に従三位に昇進し、9月には夫の家治が征夷大将軍を拝命する。
sen.e: In August 1760, she advanced to Jusani (Junior Third Rank) and in September, he husband Ieharu was appointed as Seii taishogun (literally, "great general who subdues the barbarians").

In August 1760, she was promoted to the title "Jusani" (the Junior Third Rank); In September of the same year, her husband, Ieharu was appointed as Seii Taishogun (literally, "great General who subdues the barbarians").
sen.cmt: advanced→was promoted toに訂正しました。
sen.e: In August 1760, she was promoted to the title "Jusani" (the Junior Third Rank); In September of the same year, her husband, Ieharu was appointed as Seii Taishogun (literally, "great General who subdues the barbarians").

sen.j: 宝暦11年（1761年）8月、次女万寿姫を産んだが、この姫も13歳で夭折。
sen.e: In August 1761, she gave birth to her second daughter, Manjuhime, who later died at the age of 13.
Although she gave birth to the second daughter, Manjuhime, in August 1761, the daughter died at the age of 13.
sen.cmt: Although追加し、Her second daughter→the second daughterに訂正しました。Whoをthe daughterに訂正しました。
sen.e: Although she gave birth to the second daughter, Manjuhime, in August 1761, the daughter died at the age of 13.

sen.j: 明和8年（1771年）8月20日、34歳の若さで薨去。
sen.e: On September 28, 1771, she died at the age of 34.
On August 20, 1771, Princess Tomoko died at the age of 34.
sen.cmt: She→Princess Tomokoに訂正しました。September 28→August 20に訂正しました（原文に従い）。
sen.e: On August 20, 1771, Princess Tomoko died at the age of 34.

sen.j: 江戸上野春性院にて葬られた。
sen.e: She was buried in Shunshoin in Ueno, Edo.
She was buried in the temple, Shunshoin in Ueno, Edo (the present Tokyo).
sen.cmt: the temple, (the present Tokyo)を追加しました。
sen.e: She was buried in the temple, Shunshoin in Ueno, Edo (the present Tokyo).

sen.j: 明和8年（1771年）8月23日には従二位を、さらに天明3年（1783年）8月には従一位を追贈された。
sen.e: She was conferred court rank posthumously; Junii (Junior Second Rank) on August 23, 1771 and Juichii (Junior First Rank) in August 1783.
She was conferred the court ranks after her death:"Junii" (the Junior Second Rank) on August 23, 1771 and "Juichii (the Junior First Rank) in August 1783.
sen.cmt: court rank→the court ranksに訂正しました。Posthumously→after her deathに訂正しました。;→:に訂正しました。
sen.e: She was conferred the court ranks after her death:"Junii" (the Junior Second Rank) on August 23, 1771 and "Juichii (the Junior First Rank) in August 1783.
